title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: New York has a new Archbishop. His background looks a lot like Pope Leo's
items.description: Like Pope Leo, Bishop Ronald Hicks is an Illinois native with deep experience in Latin America.

items.title: Trump Moves to End Gender-Related Care for Minors, Threatening Hospitals That Offer It
items.description: Proposed new rules would punish the hospitals by pulling all federal financing. Advocates say lawsuits will follow.

items.title: French Doctor Sentenced to Life for Fatally Poisoning 12 People
items.description: Frédéric Péchier, an anesthesiologist, was found guilty of poisoning 30 patients, of whom 12 died.

items.title: Brown Shooting: Authorities Search for a Person With Possible Connection to MIT Killing
items.description: Investigators are also examining the possibility that the case is connected to the killing of an M.I.T. professor in his home in Massachusetts.

items.title: The German Chancellor Betting on America
items.description: Friedrich Merz believes the world needs a stronger Germany. He is still navigating how to do it.

items.title: Australia to Crack Down on Hate Speech After Bondi Beach Attack
items.description: New legislation will be drafted to target those who promote violence and to increase penalties for hate speech, the prime minister said Thursday.

items.title: European Leaders Discuss Financing Ukraine With Frozen Russian Assets
items.description: The European Council convened in Brussels to discuss leveraging frozen Kremlin assets to finance Kyiv’s government and war effort.
